title: Blessington Farms Pumpkin Patch and Fall Festival
address: 510 Chisholm Rd. Simonton, TX 77476 United States
body: The Pumpkin Patch and Fall Festivities at Blessington Farms is a great outing for the entire family with many Fall activities, including hay rides, giant slides, barrel train rides, pedal cars and animal encounters with camels, Baby Doll sheep, goats and many more. Admission: $19 + tax, under 18 months get in free.

title: National Museum of Funeral History presents Annual Haunted House
address: 415 Barren Springs Dr. Houston, TX 77090 United States
body: Get in to the Halloween spirit all month long and be “scared to death” at this family-friendly haunted house. Explore different scenes designed to give goose bumps to young and old alike while taking a light-hearted view of a usually very serious subject. Admission: Tickets are $3 - $5.

title: Mad Hatter Tea Party at The Woodlands Children’s Museum
address: 4775 W Panther Creek The Woodlands, TX 77381 United States
body: Enjoy high tea and decorate cookies with the Mad Hatter and the Queen of Hearts at The Woodlands Children's Museum in a room filled with Alice in Wonderland’s whimsy. Activities include art projects, a photo booth, face painting and more. Admission   Included with general admission to the museum.

title: Oktoberfest 2017 at Saint Arnold Brewing Company
address: 2000 Lyons Ave Houston, TX 77020 United States
body: Put on your best dirndl, lederhosen or other Tyrolean duds and head to Saint Arnold’s annual Oktoberfest party. Have some German-inspired food, beer, and join in on the Oktoberfest festivities beginning at 5pm. You could even be crowned King or Queen of Oktoberfest – they’ll have a contest to see who comes outfitted the best. Admission: No cover. For $15, you can get the 20 oz commemorative mug and a 20 oz beer.

title: Film 9th Annual Indian Film Festival of Houston
address: 1370 Southmore Blvd. Houston, TX 77004 United States
body: The Indian Film Festival of Houston is devoted to education in the fields of film and television and in creating a greater appreciation of Indian cinema and culture by showcasing quality films that honor entertainment industry performers and film makers while promoting the diverse perspectives of the Indian diaspora through an annual event. Admission: tickets start at $15.

title: Orbit Slams at Discovery Green
address: 1500 Mckinney St Houston, TX 77010 United States
body: Teens ages 13 to 19 can enjoy this opportunity to hone their skills, meet other young writers, and work with professional performance poets at Discovery Green park. Admission This event is free to attend.

title: Karbachtoberfest at Karbach Brewing Co.
address: 2032 Karbach St Houston, TX 77092 United States
body: Celebrate Karbachtoberfest with four weekends of festivities, a German inspired menu, beer, live performances by Flow Tribe and more. Admission: Free to Attend.

title: Circo Avenida at Discovery Green
address: 1500 Mckinney St Houston, TX 77010 United States
body: Witness a family-friendly circus-like event with acrobats, contortionists and more at Discovery Green park. Admission  This event is free to attend.

title: 38th Annual Festival Chicano at Miller Outdoor Theatre
address: 6000 Hermann Park Drive Houston, TX 77030 United States
body: Head to the 38th Annual Festival Chicano, a cultural celebration of Chicano music from Tejano and Conjunto, to Mariachi and Orchestra at the Miller Outdoor Theatre. Admission This event is free to attend.

title: Oktoberfest at Henke & Pillot
address: 809 Congress Avenue Houston, TX 77002 United States
body: Celebrate Oktoberfest at Henke & Pillot with specials on drinks and food, German house and club music, and plenty of German beer on draft. Admission No cover.

title: Action Bronson In Concert at Warehouse Live
address: 813 St. Emanuel St. Houston, TX 77003 United States
body: American rapper and former chef Action Bronson performs at Warehouse Live. Admission Tickets are $35 in advance and $40 at the door.

title: Tim McGraw and Faith Hill in concert
address: 1510 Polk St. Houston, TX 77002 United States
body: Tim McGraw and Faith Hill will bring Soul2Soul The World Tour 2017 to Dallas, celebrating the 10th anniversary of the record-breaking Soul2Soul II tour, the highest-grossing multi-year country music tour of all time. This will be the first time Faith Hill has toured since 2007.

title: Rick Springfield and Richard Marx in Concert at Smart Financial Centre
address: 18111 Lexington Boulevard Sugar Land, TX 77479 United States
body: Rick Springfield and Richard Marx join forces to bring their catalogs of hits to Smart Financial Centre at Sugar Land to perform full solo acoustic sets. Admission Tickets start at $59.50.

title: Robert Glasper Experiment at Cullen Performance Hall
address: University of Houston, 4800 Calhoun Rd Houston, TX 77004 United States
body: Houston native, HSPVA grad, and jazz musician Robert Glasper and his band perform at the Cullen Performance Hall at the University of Houston. This event was originally scheduled at the Wortham but has to be moved due to Hurricane Harvey. Admission Tickets start at $42.50.

title: Draughts & Laughs: Beer and Comedy Show at The Secret Group
address: 2101 Polk Street Houston, TX 77003 United States
body: Stephen Brandau hosts a hilarious comedy show sponsored by Back Pew Brewing at The Secret Group. Admission $12 buys you two pints and a souvenir branded pint glass.

title: Relationsh!t with Catherine Cohen at Rec Room
address: 100 Jackson St Houston, TX 77002 United States
body: The Relationsh!t duo host a live podcast recording with the Brooklyn-based comedian Catherine Cohen to talk about relationships and more at the Rec Room. Admission Cover charge at the door.

title: Classic Numbers at Numbers
body: Houston's Longest running weekly event and the best FRIDAY NIGHT Party in town! Music & video from the 80's w/ current Classic Numbers music mixed by Dj wES wALLACE! 1.50 Well Drinks, 1.75 Domestic Beer & $2.00 Coronas till 11:00. WE PLAY VINYL - AND Videos!! Doors @ 9:00PM
